intro: Montiopsis gilliesii, commonly known as the silver leafed montiopsis, is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that store water. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale purple or white, which bloom in spring. Its adaptations to harsh environments include a thick cuticle on the leaves and the ability to go dormant during periods of extreme drought. Montiopsis gilliesii is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited for xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
